rlVizLib
Class rlVizCore

java.lang.Object
  rlVizLib.rlVizCore

public final class rlVizCore
extends java.lang.Object

rlVizCore is a new class as part of the professionalism refactoring, leading to the first official release of RL-Viz.

This class will provide an interface to the outside world to check things like what version of rlVizLib a particular class was compiled against (according to the MANIFEST of the jar it was packaged with). This way, in the future, environments and agents will be able to tell if they are compatible with the version of RLVizLib that somebody is using.

Basically, we're trying to write code so thing don't crash in ugly ways.

Since:
1.1
Author:
btanner

getRLVizLinkVersionOfClass

public static java.lang.String getRLVizLinkVersionOfClass(java.lang.Class<?> theClass)
Deprecated. 

getRLVizLinkVersionOfClass will try and lookup what Jar a particular class was loaded from, and then check for it's RLVizLib-Link-Version tag in the manifest. Basically, at runtime you are using version X, and you want to find out what version Y this code was compiled against. If the versions are different, this class might expect things that aren't really there (yet or anymore).

These versions are talking about the INTERFACE version, not the implementation version.

This will hopefully make it easy to check whether the versions of different components work together

Parameters:
theClass - Class file that you want to find out the RLVizLib compile version of.
Returns:
The value of the RLVizLib-Link-Version attribute.
